definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])

sentences.english: Men's pair oars were still the show place for the world-renownedrowers.
sentences.chinese: 男子双人单桨仍然是名将的表演。

sentences.english: Many of today's touring pros play with customized racquets .
sentences.chinese: 很多当今的网坛名将都自己定制自己的网球拍。

sentences.english: Still less while walloping the rest of the world's best in the pool?
sentences.chinese: 但要对抗其他世界泳池名将难道还是少了点吗？

sentences.english: The idea pleased Zhang Yining, a table tennis player who is a household name in China.
sentences.chinese: 中国家喻户晓的桌球名将张怡宁很欣赏这个构想。

sentences.english: I've had 12 students work on this for their graduate work.
sentences.chinese: 我和12名将其作为毕业作品的同学一起为此工作。

sentences.english: This 24-year-old tennis player was born in Slovakia.
sentences.chinese: 这位24岁的网球名将生在斯洛伐克。

definition: fierce general/valiant military leader/fig. brave individual
female general/(fig.) woman who is a leading figure in her area of expertise
to be brave and good at fighting (idiom)
general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot
Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
achievement/meritorious deed/contributions (for the good of society)
to win as a result of tenacious effort/to fight off tough competition
